taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek inaein , to clean, alluding to medicinal effects; or Latin inula , an ancient name for elecampane]

bio:treatment.discussion: The three species in the flora are probably escapes from cultivation. Formerly, Inula was circumscribed more broadly.

key_statement.description: Blades of basal (and proximal cauline) leaves 100–200 mm wide; involucres (20–)30–40 mm diam.; outer phyllaries 6–8(–20+) mm wide
Blades of basal (and proximal cauline) leaves mostly 10–30 mm wide; involucres 7–15(–20) mm diam.; outer phyllaries mostly 0.5–2.5 mm wide.
Blades of cauline leaves lance-elliptic to lance-linear (venation not raised adaxially, reticulation not evident); outer phyllaries 4–6 × 0.5–0.8 mm
Blades of cauline leaves broadly elliptic to lanceolate (venation raised adaxially, reticulation prominent); outer phyllaries 5–7 × 1.5–2.5 mm
